And the LORD<S>3068</S> spake<S>1696</S> unto Moses<S>4872</S> in mount<S>2022</S> Sinai<S>5514</S>, saying<S>559</S>,
Speak<S>1696</S> unto the children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>, and say<S>559</S> unto them, When ye come<S>935</S> into the land<S>776</S> which I give<S>5414</S> you, then shall the land<S>776</S> keep<S>7673</S> a sabbath<S>7676</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S>. <sup>keep: Heb. rest</sup>
Six<S>8337</S> years<S>8141</S> thou shalt sow<S>2232</S> thy field<S>7704</S>, and six<S>8337</S> years<S>8141</S> thou shalt prune<S>2168</S> thy vineyard<S>3754</S>, and gather<S>622</S> in the fruit<S>8393</S> thereof;
But in the seventh<S>7637</S> year<S>8141</S> shall be a sabbath<S>7676</S> of rest<S>7677</S> unto the land<S>776</S>, a sabbath<S>7676</S> for the LORD<S>3068</S>: thou shalt neither sow<S>2232</S> thy field<S>7704</S>, nor prune<S>2168</S> thy vineyard<S>3754</S>.
That which groweth of its own accord<S>5599</S> of thy harvest<S>7105</S> thou shalt not reap<S>7114</S>, neither gather<S>1219</S> the grapes<S>6025</S> of thy vine undressed<S>5139</S>: for it is a year<S>8141</S> of rest<S>7677</S> unto the land<S>776</S>. <sup>of thy vine: Heb. of thy separation</sup>
And the sabbath<S>7676</S> of the land<S>776</S> shall be meat<S>402</S> for you; for thee, and for thy servant<S>5650</S>, and for thy maid<S>519</S>, and for thy hired servant<S>7916</S>, and for thy stranger<S>8453</S> that sojourneth<S>1481</S> with thee,
And for thy cattle<S>929</S>, and for the beast<S>2416</S> that are in thy land<S>776</S>, shall all the increase<S>8393</S> thereof be meat<S>398</S>.
And thou shalt number<S>5608</S> seven<S>7651</S> sabbaths<S>7676</S> of years<S>8141</S> unto thee, seven<S>7651</S> times<S>6471</S> seven<S>7651</S> years<S>8141</S>; and the space<S>3117</S> of the seven<S>7651</S> sabbaths<S>7676</S> of years<S>8141</S> shall be unto thee forty<S>705</S> and nine<S>8672</S> years<S>8141</S>.
Then shalt thou cause the trumpet<S>7782</S> of the jubile<S>8643</S> to sound<S>5674</S> on the tenth<S>6218</S> day of the seventh<S>7637</S> month<S>2320</S>, in the day<S>3117</S> of atonement<S>3725</S> shall ye make the trumpet<S>7782</S> sound<S>5674</S> throughout all your land<S>776</S>. <sup>of the jubile: Heb. loud of sound</sup>
And ye shall hallow<S>6942</S> the fiftieth<S>2572</S> <S>8141</S> year<S>8141</S>, and proclaim<S>7121</S> liberty<S>1865</S> throughout all the land<S>776</S> unto all the inhabitants<S>3427</S> thereof: it shall be a jubile<S>3104</S> unto you; and ye shall return<S>7725</S> every man<S>376</S> unto his possession<S>272</S>, and ye shall return<S>7725</S> every man<S>376</S> unto his family<S>4940</S>.
A jubile<S>3104</S> shall that fiftieth<S>2572</S> <S>8141</S> year<S>8141</S> be unto you: ye shall not sow<S>2232</S>, neither reap<S>7114</S> that which groweth<S>5599</S> of itself in it, nor gather<S>1219</S> the grapes in it of thy vine undressed<S>5139</S>.
For it is the jubile<S>3104</S>; it shall be holy<S>6944</S> unto you: ye shall eat<S>398</S> the increase<S>8393</S> thereof out of the field<S>7704</S>.
In the year<S>8141</S> of this jubile<S>3104</S> ye shall return<S>7725</S> every man<S>376</S> unto his possession<S>272</S>.
And if thou sell<S>4376</S> ought<S>4465</S> unto thy neighbour<S>5997</S>, or buyest<S>7069</S> ought of thy neighbour's<S>5997</S> hand<S>3027</S>, ye shall not oppress<S>3238</S> one<S>376</S> another<S>251</S>:
According to the number<S>4557</S> of years<S>8141</S> after<S>310</S> the jubile<S>3104</S> thou shalt buy<S>7069</S> of thy neighbour<S>5997</S>, and according unto the number<S>4557</S> of years<S>8141</S> of the fruits<S>8393</S> he shall sell<S>4376</S> unto thee:
According<S>6310</S> to the multitude<S>7230</S> of years<S>8141</S> thou shalt increase<S>7235</S> the price<S>4736</S> thereof, and according<S>6310</S> to the fewness<S>4591</S> of years<S>8141</S> thou shalt diminish<S>4591</S> the price<S>4736</S> of it: for according to the number<S>4557</S> of the years of the fruits<S>8393</S> doth he sell<S>4376</S> unto thee.
Ye shall not therefore oppress<S>3238</S> one<S>376</S> another<S>5997</S>; but thou shalt fear<S>3372</S> thy God<S>430</S>: for I am the LORD<S>3068</S> your God<S>430</S>.
Wherefore ye shall do<S>6213</S> my statutes<S>2708</S>, and keep<S>8104</S> my judgments<S>4941</S>, and do<S>6213</S> them; and ye shall dwell<S>3427</S> in the land<S>776</S> in safety<S>983</S>.
And the land<S>776</S> shall yield<S>5414</S> her fruit<S>6529</S>, and ye shall eat<S>398</S> your fill<S>7648</S>, and dwell<S>3427</S> therein in safety<S>983</S>.
And if ye shall say<S>559</S>, What shall we eat<S>398</S> the seventh<S>7637</S> year<S>8141</S>? behold, we shall not sow<S>2232</S>, nor gather<S>622</S> in our increase<S>8393</S>:
Then I will command<S>6680</S> my blessing<S>1293</S> upon you in the sixth<S>8345</S> year<S>8141</S>, and it shall bring forth<S>6213</S> fruit<S>8393</S> for three<S>7969</S> years<S>8141</S>.
And ye shall sow<S>2232</S> the eighth<S>8066</S> year<S>8141</S>, and eat<S>398</S> yet of old<S>3465</S> fruit<S>8393</S> until the ninth<S>8671</S> year<S>8141</S>; until her fruits<S>8393</S> come in<S>935</S> ye shall eat<S>398</S> of the old<S>3465</S> store.
The land<S>776</S> shall not be sold<S>4376</S> for ever<S>6783</S>: for the land<S>776</S> is mine; for ye are strangers<S>1616</S> and sojourners<S>8453</S> with me. <sup>for ever: or, to be quite cut off: Heb. for cutting off</sup>
And in all the land<S>776</S> of your possession<S>272</S> ye shall grant<S>5414</S> a redemption<S>1353</S> for the land<S>776</S>.
If thy brother<S>251</S> be waxen poor<S>4134</S>, and hath sold<S>4376</S> away some of his possession<S>272</S>, and if any of his kin<S>7138</S> come<S>935</S> to redeem<S>1350</S> it, then shall he redeem<S>1350</S> that which his brother<S>251</S> sold<S>4465</S>.
And if the man<S>376</S> have none to redeem<S>1350</S> it, and himself<S>3027</S> be able<S>1767</S> <S>5381</S> to redeem<S>4672</S> <S>1353</S> it; <sup>himself: Heb. his hand hath attained and found sufficiency</sup>
Then let him count<S>2803</S> the years<S>8141</S> of the sale<S>4465</S> thereof, and restore<S>7725</S> the overplus<S>5736</S> unto the man<S>376</S> to whom he sold<S>4376</S> it; that he may return<S>7725</S> unto his possession<S>272</S>.
But if he<S>3027</S> be not able<S>1767</S> to restore<S>4672</S> <S>7725</S> it to him, then that which is sold<S>4465</S> shall remain in the hand<S>3027</S> of him that hath bought<S>7069</S> it until the year<S>8141</S> of jubile<S>3104</S>: and in the jubile<S>3104</S> it shall go out<S>3318</S>, and he shall return<S>7725</S> unto his possession<S>272</S>.
And if a man<S>376</S> sell<S>4376</S> a dwelling<S>4186</S> house<S>1004</S> in a walled<S>2346</S> city<S>5892</S>, then he may redeem<S>1353</S> it within a whole<S>8552</S> year<S>8141</S> after it is sold<S>4465</S>; within a full year<S>3117</S> may he redeem<S>1353</S> it.
And if it be not redeemed<S>1350</S> within the space<S>4390</S> of a full<S>8549</S> year<S>8141</S>, then the house<S>1004</S> that is in the walled<S>2346</S> city<S>5892</S> shall be established<S>6965</S> for ever<S>6783</S> to him that bought<S>7069</S> it throughout his generations<S>1755</S>: it shall not go out<S>3318</S> in the jubile<S>3104</S>.
But the houses<S>1004</S> of the villages<S>2691</S> which have no wall<S>2346</S> round about<S>5439</S> them shall be counted<S>2803</S> as the fields<S>7704</S> of the country<S>776</S>: they may be redeemed<S>1353</S>, and they shall go out<S>3318</S> in the jubile<S>3104</S>. <sup>they may: Heb. redemption belongeth unto it</sup>
Notwithstanding the cities<S>5892</S> of the Levites<S>3881</S>, and the houses<S>1004</S> of the cities<S>5892</S> of their possession<S>272</S>, may the Levites<S>3881</S> redeem<S>1353</S> at any time<S>5769</S>.
And if a man purchase<S>1350</S> of the Levites<S>3881</S>, then the house<S>1004</S> that was sold<S>4465</S>, and the city<S>5892</S> of his possession<S>272</S>, shall go out<S>3318</S> in the year of jubile<S>3104</S>: for the houses<S>1004</S> of the cities<S>5892</S> of the Levites<S>3881</S> are their possession<S>272</S> among<S>8432</S> the children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>. <sup>a man: or, one of the Levites redeem them</sup>
But the field<S>7704</S> of the suburbs<S>4054</S> of their cities<S>5892</S> may not be sold<S>4376</S>; for it is their perpetual<S>5769</S> possession<S>272</S>.
And if thy brother<S>251</S> be waxen poor<S>4134</S>, and fallen in decay<S>4131</S> with thee<S>3027</S>; then thou shalt relieve<S>2388</S> him: yea, though he be a stranger<S>1616</S>, or a sojourner<S>8453</S>; that he may live<S>2416</S> with thee. <sup>fallen: Heb. his hand faileth</sup> <sup>relieve: Heb. strengthen</sup>
Take<S>3947</S> thou no usury<S>5392</S> of him, or increase<S>8636</S>: but fear<S>3372</S> thy God<S>430</S>; that thy brother<S>251</S> may live<S>2416</S> with thee.
Thou shalt not give<S>5414</S> him thy money<S>3701</S> upon usury<S>5392</S>, nor lend<S>5414</S> him thy victuals<S>400</S> for increase<S>4768</S>.
I am the LORD<S>3068</S> your God<S>430</S>, which brought you forth<S>3318</S> out of the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, to give<S>5414</S> you the land<S>776</S> of Canaan<S>3667</S>, and to be your God<S>430</S>.
And if thy brother<S>251</S> that dwelleth by thee be waxen poor<S>4134</S>, and be sold<S>4376</S> unto thee; thou shalt not compel<S>5647</S> him to serve<S>5656</S> as a bondservant<S>5650</S>: <sup>compel: Heb. serve thyself with him with the service, etc</sup>
But as an hired servant<S>7916</S>, and as a sojourner<S>8453</S>, he shall be with thee, and shall serve<S>5647</S> thee unto the year<S>8141</S> of jubile<S>3104</S>:
And then shall he depart<S>3318</S> from thee, both he and his children<S>1121</S> with him, and shall return<S>7725</S> unto his own family<S>4940</S>, and unto the possession<S>272</S> of his fathers<S>1</S> shall he return<S>7725</S>.
For they are my servants<S>5650</S>, which I brought forth<S>3318</S> out of the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>: they shall not be sold<S>4376</S> as<S>4466</S> bondmen<S>5650</S>. <sup>as: Heb. with the sale of a bondman</sup>
Thou shalt not rule<S>7287</S> over him with rigour<S>6531</S>; but shalt fear<S>3372</S> thy God<S>430</S>.
Both thy bondmen<S>5650</S>, and thy bondmaids<S>519</S>, which thou shalt have, shall be of the heathen<S>1471</S> that are round about<S>5439</S> you; of them shall ye buy<S>7069</S> bondmen<S>5650</S> and bondmaids<S>519</S>.
Moreover of the children<S>1121</S> of the strangers<S>8453</S> that do sojourn<S>1481</S> among you, of them shall ye buy<S>7069</S>, and of their families<S>4940</S> that are with you, which they begat<S>3205</S> in your land<S>776</S>: and they shall be your possession<S>272</S>.
And ye shall take them as an inheritance<S>5157</S> for your children<S>1121</S> after<S>310</S> you, to inherit<S>3423</S> them for a possession<S>272</S>; they shall be your bondmen<S>5647</S> for ever<S>5769</S>: but over your brethren<S>251</S> the children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>, ye shall not rule<S>7287</S> one<S>376</S> over another<S>251</S> with rigour<S>6531</S>. <sup>they: Heb. ye shall serve yourselves with them</sup>
And if a sojourner<S>1616</S> or stranger<S>8453</S> wax rich<S>5381</S> by thee<S>3027</S>, and thy brother<S>251</S> that dwelleth by him wax poor<S>4134</S>, and sell<S>4376</S> himself unto the stranger<S>1616</S> or sojourner<S>8453</S> by thee, or to the stock<S>6133</S> of the stranger's<S>1616</S> family<S>4940</S>: <sup>wax rich: Heb. his hand obtain, etc</sup>
After<S>310</S> that he is sold<S>4376</S> he may be redeemed again<S>1353</S>; one<S>259</S> of his brethren<S>251</S> may redeem<S>1350</S> him:
Either his uncle<S>1730</S>, or his uncle's<S>1730</S> son<S>1121</S>, may redeem<S>1350</S> him, or any that is nigh<S>7607</S> of kin<S>1320</S> unto him of his family<S>4940</S> may redeem<S>1350</S> him; or if he be able<S>5381</S>, he may redeem<S>1350</S> himself<S>3027</S>.
And he shall reckon<S>2803</S> with him that bought<S>7069</S> him from the year<S>8141</S> that he was sold<S>4376</S> to him unto the year<S>8141</S> of jubile<S>3104</S>: and the price<S>3701</S> of his sale<S>4465</S> shall be according unto the number<S>4557</S> of years<S>8141</S>, according to the time<S>3117</S> of an hired servant<S>7916</S> shall it be with him.
If there be yet many<S>7227</S> years<S>8141</S> behind, according<S>6310</S> unto them he shall give again<S>7725</S> the price of his redemption<S>1353</S> out of the money<S>3701</S> that he was bought<S>4736</S> for.
And if there remain<S>7604</S> but few<S>4592</S> years<S>8141</S> unto the year<S>8141</S> of jubile<S>3104</S>, then he shall count<S>2803</S> with him, and according<S>6310</S> unto his years<S>8141</S> shall he give him again<S>7725</S> the price of his redemption<S>1353</S>.
And as a yearly<S>8141</S> <S>8141</S> hired servant<S>7916</S> shall he be with him: and the other shall not rule<S>7287</S> with rigour<S>6531</S> over him in thy sight<S>5869</S>.
And if he be not redeemed<S>1350</S> in these years, then he shall go out<S>3318</S> in the year<S>8141</S> of jubile<S>3104</S>, both he, and his children<S>1121</S> with him. <sup>in these: or, by these means</sup>
For unto me the children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S> are servants<S>5650</S>; they are my servants<S>5650</S> whom I brought forth<S>3318</S> out of the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>: I am the LORD<S>3068</S> your God<S>430</S>.
